item.title: Karen add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "I have chosen to be happy because it is good for my health." -- Voltaire

item.title: Karen add a quote by Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
item.description: "Be happy. It's one way of being wise." -- Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

item.title: Karen add a quote by Donald Barthelme
item.description: "The death of God left the angels in a strange position." -- Donald Barthelme

item.title: Karen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "What do you fear, lady?" [Aragorn] asked. "A cage," [Ã‰owyn] said. "To stay behind bars, until use and old age accept them, and all chance of doing great deeds is gone beyond recall or desire." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Karen add a quote by Seneca
item.description: "True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not." -- Seneca

item.title: Karen add a quote by Hippocrates
item.description: "The life so short, the craft so long to learn. " -- Hippocrates
